alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 11:31AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Albany and southeastern Schoharie Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gilboa, or 17 miles south of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Breakabeen around 1140 AM EDT. Livingstonville and Preston-Potter Hollow around 1145 AM EDT. Middleburgh around 1155 AM EDT. Berne around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include East Berne, Zucks Corners, Bensons Corners, West Berne, Huntersland, Conesville, Bates, Manorkill, Broome Center and West Middleburgh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
